alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Monroe and Noble. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marshall, Ohio and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wheeling, Moundsville, Bellaire, Barnesville, Bethlehem, Woodsfield, Caldwell, Shadyside, McMechen, Powhatan Point, Glen Dale, Cameron, Dudley, Benwood, Bethesda, Sardis, Belmont, Beallsville, Clarington and Neffs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
